title: Network address translation (NAT) gateway
description: Network address translation (NAT) is a method of mapping an IP address space into another by modifying network address information in the IP header of packets while they are in transit across a traffic routing device.
key-ideas: Map internal private network addresses and ports to Internet-routable addresses and ports.
Use port forwarding on a NAT gateway to expose internal, privately addresses services to the Internet.
Many-to-one NATs translate the many internal private IP addresses to a single external, routeable IP address.
